content.description: Sustained quality climbing on great featured granite.  Start at a low overhang and do a fun boulder problem over the roof.  Move slightly left and head up tricky moves on dikes, then up right to and undercling/flake system.  Head up this to the top.
This tricky little number ascends the short face right of the Satterfield Corner.  Great dike pinching with no so great feet.  Harder than it looks.

Thin cracks and face lead over a small overlap past a large grey knob to a tricky, thin section above your gear as you stem/lieback offset seams to gain a ledge above the difficulties.

The protection on this is decent for most of the route, and you can even get some good RP's in before the crux, but you'll be doing the hardest moves a ways out so make sure you're solid before leading this one.
content.protection: Gear to 2" including microwires, sling for tie-off, triple coldshut anchor (shared with Mongoloid, Mr. D.N.A.).
content.location:
Left side of the North Face, just right of

Mr. D.N.A.

.

content.description: The obvious thin crack that passes a tree near the top (hint: it's easier on the right side). This is a fun route that's essentially face climbing with a thin crack for protection.
content.protection: Gear to 2", triple shut anchor (shared with Mongoloid, Mr. Kamikaze).
content.location:
Left side of the North Face, just right of

Mongoloid

.

content.description: Tricky and somewhat insecure climbing up the far left, slabby arete. The crux is difficult to read and involves moving around the arete.

Start with some interesting face climbing directly below the prominent dike between Box Lunch and Lesbie Friends. Follow the dike straight up until a large undercling is encountered at 3/4 height. Trend rightward above this feature to the crux, then continue up, eventually traversing over to the easy finish on Lesbie Friends.

I understand that the original developers of the crag have previously been asked about bolting this line and did not give their blessing. I did stand on one hold used for Lesbie friends and used a couple pinches shared with Box Lunch when it moves rightward, but otherwise this is an independent climb best top-roped from the Lesbie Friends anchor. For what it's worth, I enjoyed this route more than it's rightward neighbor.

I cannot be the first person to have done this, so please add this info or let me know.
content.location: Directly below the prominent dike between Box Lunch and Lesbie Friends.

content.description: Awesome sustained face climbing right of Box Lunch.  Difficult face climbing leads up to a diagonal crack feature which leads you right and then back left.  Catch your breath and cast out into another cruxy face section and finally up to the anchors.  Excellent climbing.

climbs.name: It's All in the Genes
climbs.fa: Donette & Todd Swain, Joe Stapp and Deron Smith August 2004

content.description:
Start at the base of

Satterfield Corner

and climb up along dikes past several bolts. Rap from an anchor with one rope. This line is 8-10 feet right of

Kamikaze.
content.protection: Bolted route with a couple optional pieces on the lower corner. Lower from an anchor at the top.

content.location: Right of Feather Ruffler, bolt line leans right and crosses over Double Ender (10c) which is the bolt line directly to the right.
Right of Lesbie friends. Lower off.

content.description:
Go up over a buldge, cross over

Going Both Ways

, and head left to a seam. Balancy and sustained.
content.protection: Seven bolts to a two bolt anchor which is equipped for lowering off.
content.location:
Right of

Going Both Ways

. Lower off.

content.description: This is the obvious thin crack (which doesn't reach the ground)on the far right side of the wall. Climb one or two tricky moves to a bolt that is hard to clip if you're short. You may want to stick clip this bolt, as the landing is poor. Send the crux face move at the bolt to reach the crack. Then, climb the sustained 5.10 thin crack, which can be challenging to protect--especially at its start. Enjoy engaging climbing to the route's end.
content.location: This is the second-to-last route on the far right side of the north wall. Look for the thin crack starting 15' off the ground.

content.description: Start just to the right of Quick Link.  Make a strange, mantle type move past the first bolt to gain the flake which is followed up and right.  Another tricky move takes you up the face to the anchors.
Stem and pinch dikes. Crux after 5th bolt, thin delicate movement.
content.location:
Center of the wall, has a hole halfway up. Just right of Black Leather, the right-facing 11a

dihedral. Lower off.

content.description: The obvious right facing dihedral in the center of the face.  Don't underestimate this one.  Definitely harder than it appears from the ground.  Varied, technical but strenuous moves lead up the dihedral, exiting out left near the top.  Engaging.  Originally done without bolts!
